scenes.text: Yuto Aokawa is an ordinary office worker at an IT company. His hobbies are the internet and manga, and he has a decent number of friends. He doesn't have a girlfriend.

His grades in school weren't bad, and he neither liked nor disliked sports. It's been five years since he started working, and he's been given more and more responsibilities, spending his days swamped with work.
He had been living the life of a typical office worker.
Aokawa: 'What in the world has gotten into me?'
He was bewildered by his own actions from a moment ago.
Today, Aokawa was working as usual. On his way to a business appointment, he stopped by a convenience store in a park and fell in love at first sight with the clerk.
The convenience store clerk, Hoshina, was about to leave the store after her shift, saying goodbye to her colleagues, when Aokawa came in.
As they passed each other, Aokawa unconsciously blurted out and confessed to her in front of the convenience store. Being a rather reserved person, he had never done anything like this before.
His body had moved so naturally that he had confessed before he knew it. Fortunately, or perhaps luckily, Hoshina didn't seem to think he was a bad guy and they exchanged contact information.
Aokawa: 'It's a miracle that she didn't reject such a suspicious guy. And she's so cute....'

items.text: Am I handsome?
Is this what they call a fateful choice?

scenes.text: He would never make the mistake of thinking he was handsome. Aokawa was that kind of man. Normally, he would have kept his distance from Hoshina, who was so beautiful that she was out of his league.
Of course, he didn't dislike beautiful women. But more than that, a strange feeling welled up inside him when he thought of Hoshina.
Aokawa: 'Is this... love at first sight?'
He was confused, but he gradually calmed down and then began to worry about how to contact her.
When you start off like this, what kind of message are you supposed to send first...?
While he was thinking about it, he arrived at his workplace, so he pushed his worries to the back of his mind and immersed himself in his work.

It was past 11 p.m. when Aokawa got home. It had been another hectic day. As he took a shower, he wondered if these days would continue forever, and as he reflected on his day, he suddenly realized something.
Aokawa: 'I haven't contacted Hoshina-san!'
It was too rude not to contact her at all after what he had done. She would think he was joking. He hurriedly finished his shower, picked up his phone, and froze.
He didn't know what to send. Should he confess his love, make small talk, introduce himself, or tell a funny story? What was the right answer...?
But he couldn't send a message too late at night. Aokawa was starting to panic.

items.text: Should I just send something random?
No, should I take my time and write a proper message?

scenes.text: As he was doing so, the night grew later and later.... Reporting, contacting, and consulting are the basics of a working adult. The later the contact, the worse the situation becomes.
To think this would be his first time.... If there was a ranking for disappointing first moves, wouldn't he be in it?
With that thought, Aokawa sent a message to Hoshina.
'I am very sorry for the trouble I caused you today. It is already late, so I will contact you again tomorrow.'

chapters.title: Let's Get to Know Each Other

scenes.text: Aokawa's condition was the worst.

After sending the email to Hoshina, he couldn't sleep due to regret for his own inadequacy and thinking about how to recover, leaving him sleep-deprived. Although he managed to get his work done, it was clear to everyone around him that he was exhausted.
'What's up today? You look really tired.'
scenes.voice: 今日はどしたん_めっちゃ辛そうじゃん

scenes.text: His colleague from the same project, Yosuke Naruse, called out to him.
Naruse was a man with a nice smile and was good at his work. He might look a bit flashy, but his work ethic showed he was serious, and he got along well with Aokawa.
Aokawa: '...I wonder if this is what you call a bolt from the blue.'
Naruse: 'Love troubles?'
scenes.voice: 恋の悩みか

scenes.text: Aokawa: '?!'
Aokawa: 'Are you a resident of some convenient-plot country? The pacing of this conversation is too good!'
Naruse: 'Tehepero.'
scenes.voice: てへぺろっ

scenes.text: Naruse: 'Well, romantic relationships have their own unique atmosphere. If it weren't for me, you'd miss it.'
scenes.voice: まあ恋愛関係は独特の雰囲気ってものがあるのさ_俺じゃなきゃ見逃しちゃうけどね

scenes.text: Aokawa: '...That's why I've been worrying about various things and haven't been sleeping well.'
Naruse: 'That's a project risk. Let's have lunch together.'
scenes.voice: そいつはプロジェクトリスクだな_ひる飯一緒に食おうぜ

scenes.text: He's too handsome. I could fall for him.

scenes.text: Naruse: 'There's a lot to comment on, but for now, you need to contact her. As it is, you've only made a business-like contact.'
scenes.voice: 色々突っ込む点はあるが_とりあえずその子に連絡しなきゃな_今のままじゃ業務連絡をしただけだ

scenes.text: The pace of the conversation is so good it makes my heart flutter. Oh no, is this love?
Aokawa: 'Thanks. Things have been moving so fast since yesterday, I don't know what to do.'

scenes.voice: 相手も突然だしな_とりあえず普通に自己紹介だろ_自分のことを知ってもらわないと
scenes.text: Naruse: 'It was sudden for her too. For now, just a normal self-introduction. You have to let her know about yourself.'
Aokawa: 'I see, you're right...'

scenes.voice: 相手は見ず知らずのお前に付き合ってくれるんだ_相手が会話に疲れないようにしろ_無難な話題_質問から初
scenes.text: Naruse: 'She's giving a complete stranger a chance. Make sure she doesn't get tired of the conversation. Start with safe topics and questions to find out what she's interested in.'
Aokawa: 'Oh no, is this love?'
Naruse, what a reliable guy. He tells me to send it during the lunch break, so I type it out, but my hand freezes over the send button.

scenes.voice: 別に悪くないから_送っちまえ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'It's not bad, just send it.'
Pushed by Naruse, I send it.
The content is a normal self-introduction. I thought sending a long message right away would be weird, so I kept it to about 3-4 sentences, not too long, not too short.
It's okay... It'll surely be okay. This is under the guidance of the handsome Naruse.

scenes.voice: お疲れさん_ところで_今日は進捗定例があるが準備大丈夫か
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Good work. By the way, there's a progress meeting today, are you prepared?'
I had completely forgotten, so after finishing lunch, I hurried back to my desk. Naruse is handsome in every way.
The afternoon meetings were over, and it was past 3 p.m.
I'm the type to forget everything else when I concentrate, and I suddenly remembered I hadn't checked my phone since then. I looked at my phone and saw a notification. My heart pounded a little.
'Thank you for your hard work! This is my first time doing this, so I'm nervous!'
That's how the reply began. The content was innocuous. Good, at least I haven't been rejected. I was relieved....
Then I realized. I've already read it. It would be rude not to respond after seeing it. But I have another meeting soon and no time to think. I have no choice....
'Thank you for confirming! I will reply later!'

scenes.voice: 携帯着信
scenes.text: 'Another business-like message lol'
A reply came back immediately. I know, I'm a boring guy.
I take a deep breath and pull myself together. For now, I'll focus on the work in front of me and head to the progress report for the PM.
Three days have passed since I started contacting Hoshina. I've gotten to know her a little better.
- Hoshina is 27, two years younger than Aokawa. - She lives alone. - She used to live abroad (she only told me it was a remote place).
- She's currently working part-time at a convenience store. - She works almost every day without a break. - She's not good with machines.
- She's interested in manga and anime. - She likes Italian food.
And so on.
Basically, I've been focusing on letting her get to know me, so she probably knows more about me than I know about her.

scenes.voice: そろそろ会う約束でもしたらどうだ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Why don't you ask her out soon?'
Naruse says as we eat lunch. I can't help but stop my chopsticks.
Aokawa: 'Would a suspicious guy like me be able to meet her?'

scenes.voice: もっともだな
scenes.text: Naruse: 'That's a good point.'
I wanted you to deny that.

scenes.voice: 俺も付き合うから
scenes.text: Naruse: 'I'll come with you.'

items.text: ...A three-person relationship is a novel idea.
Could it be that he's after me??

scenes.text: Naruse: 'Are you an idiot! It's easier to meet if you both bring a friend. I'm curious about the person you fell in love with at first sight.'
Aokawa: 'The problem is that Naruse is too handsome. If you compare the moon and a water flea, anyone would choose the moon.'

scenes.voice: 卑屈すぎるだろ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'You're being too self-deprecating...'
But it's also true that I feel at ease when Naruse is around.
Aokawa: 'I should have done this kind of thing when I was a student... I feel like I'm back in my school days...'
As I said that, I discussed the plan with Naruse.
The day to meet Hoshina has come. Work has been as busy as ever, but thinking about today has kept me going, and whenever I had a spare moment, I would daydream about what we would talk about.
That said, it's just a 2-on-2 lunch today. If I can get her to know me here, I'll try asking her out on a 1-on-1 date next time.
We've booked a restaurant at a hotel, so I'm waiting with Naruse in the hotel lobby for Hoshina and her friend. The restaurant is neither too expensive nor too cheap. Of course, Naruse chose it.

scenes.voice: そんなに緊張はしてなさどうだな
scenes.text: Naruse: 'You don't seem that nervous.'
Aokawa: 'Well, it's not just the two of us today. Maybe the joy of seeing her again is winning out. Ah...'
Aokawa: 'Hoshina-san!'
Hoshina-san has arrived.
Hmm...?
Could Hoshina-san's companion be this old man...?

scenes.voice: 遅れました
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Aokawa-san! Sorry I'm late!'
Aokawa: 'No, I just got here. You're right on time.'
Aokawa: 'Thank you so much for coming today. This is my colleague, Naruse.'

scenes.voice: いえ_初めてのお店なので楽しみです
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'No, I'm excited because it's my first time at this restaurant.'

scenes.voice: お店の店長の渋川さんです
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'This is the manager of the store, Shibukawa-san.'
So the incredibly buff old man is the convenience store manager... he looks pretty tough.... Am I being watched after all?
Aokawa: 'Shibukawa-san, you're very well-built. Do you do any kind of training?'

scenes.voice: 昔はいろいろやっていたが_今では趣味でトレーニングをしているだけだな
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'I used to do a lot of things, but now I just train as a hobby.'

scenes.voice: 傭兵で文字通り世界中を飛び回って回ってたそうですよ
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'He used to be a mercenary and literally traveled all over the world.'
That's a lot of information for a single conversation. Is a first-time conversation always this hard?
Wait, what, if I'm deemed a bad guy today, am I going to be eliminated? I can see that even the handsome Naruse's smile is a little strained.
Aokawa: 'This is very interesting, or rather, so interesting that the conversation will never end, so let's go to the restaurant for now.'
With that, we moved to the restaurant.
'Cheers!'
After introducing ourselves to each other, we raised a toast when our first drinks arrived.

scenes.voice: 成瀬さんは_碧川さんと同期なんですか
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Naruse-san, are you and Aokawa-san colleagues from the same year?'
Aokawa: 'That's right. We're assigned to the same project now, so we have a lot of opportunities to talk, and I consulted with Naruse about this.'

scenes.voice: 碧川は真面目で色恋の話はまったく聞いたことなかったんで驚きましたよ_いきなり告白してきたんでしょ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Aokawa is a serious person and I've never heard him talk about love, so I was surprised. You confessed to him out of the blue, right?'

scenes.voice: うむ_店の中から飛び出すべきか迷っていたぞ
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'Well, I was wondering if I should jump out of the store.'

items.text: I'm so sorry for the trouble I caused you then...
I didn't know what I was doing at the time...

scenes.text: If I had made one wrong move, my life might have ended that day.... I shivered for a moment.

scenes.voice: まあいきなりだと警戒しますよね_お前_生きてて良かったな_明日生きてるかは今日の結果次第だけど
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Well, it's natural to be wary of a sudden confession. You're lucky to be alive. Whether you'll be alive tomorrow depends on today's results.'

scenes.voice: あ_別にそういう目的で渋川さんを連れてきたわけじゃなくて_友達があまりいないので今日は渋川さんにお願
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Oh, I didn't bring Shibukawa-san for that reason. I don't have many friends, so I asked him to come with me today.'

scenes.voice: 星奈くんの人の見る目は確かなので心配しておらん_今日は友人として参加させてもらっておる
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'I'm not worried because Hoshina-kun is a good judge of character. I'm here today as a friend.'
Shibukawa's eyes aren't smiling as he says that...
Aokawa: 'Hoshina-san, have you been working at your current job for a long time?'

scenes.voice: 半年ぐらいですね
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'About half a year.'

scenes.voice: 星奈くんが来てから客が増えた気がするな_たまに悪い虫がいるので駆除しておるが
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'I feel like we've had more customers since Hoshina-kun started working here. Although, there are some bad bugs that I have to exterminate from time to time.'
It's scary when you say that while looking at me, so please stop....

scenes.voice: 渋川さんはモテるんですよ
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Shibukawa-san is very popular.'

scenes.voice: やっぱり筋肉か____筋肉が全てなのか
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Is it the muscles... Are muscles everything?'

scenes.voice: 確かに筋肉は嘘をつかんな
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'Muscles don't lie.'
Aokawa: 'I'd be in trouble if you got any more handsome, so please maintain your current muscle mass.'

scenes.voice: 星奈さんはマッチョが好きですか
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Hoshina-san, do you like muscular guys?'

scenes.voice: 私ですか_つよいに越したことはないと思いますけど_あまり考えたことないですね____あ_私に敬語はい
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Me? I don't think it's a bad thing to be strong, but I've never really thought about it. ...Oh, you don't have to use honorifics with me. I'm younger than you.'
Aokawa: 'That's right. Let's just talk to each other casually.'

scenes.voice: というか_お前ずっと硬い口調でやり取り続けてたの
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Wait, have you been talking to her in a stiff tone this whole time?'
Aokawa: 'No, I just didn't know when to switch...'
From here on, the young people's conversation flowed. At first, I felt like I was being judged by Shibukawa-san, but now he's completely in the position of a guardian, watching over us warmly.
Maybe that was his intention from the beginning, and I was just being too nervous.
'Thank you for today.'
The mealtime passed in a flash, and it was time to part ways.

scenes.voice: 星奈さん_めちゃ可愛いな
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Hoshina-san is so cute.'
Aokawa: 'I know, right? She's so cute.'

scenes.voice: 渋川さん_謎だな
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Shibukawa-san is a mystery.'
Aokawa: 'His character is too strong... At first, I thought I was going to die here.'
I want to savor the memory of Hoshina's smile, but Shibukawa's muscles keep coming to mind.

scenes.voice: 別に悪い印象はないだろうし_次は二人でのデートに誘ってみろよ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'I don't think she has a bad impression of you, so you should ask her out on a date for just the two of you next time.'
Aokawa: 'Yeah, I'll try asking her.'

scenes.voice: じゃ_俺はここで_また会社でな
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Well, I'm off. See you at the office.'
Aokawa: 'Yeah, thanks.'
With that, Naruse and I parted ways.
It's still early afternoon, and the sky is bright. It's too early to go home, so I'm just wandering around aimlessly.

scenes.voice: 携帯着信
scenes.text: Suddenly, my phone rings. Could it be Hoshina-san? My heart pounds as I look at the screen, but it's from my sister.
I have a younger sister who goes to a local university. We get along well, and she sometimes sends me trivial messages.
'Sniff, sniff... I smell a woman...'
Wait, what, am I being watched? I instinctively look around, but of course, no one is there.
A follow-up message arrives.
'Yuu-kun's love luck is soaring to a stop-limit high, you know. The shrine's fortune slip said you should go all-in on a margin buy now.'
There's a shrine in my hometown, and the child of the shrine's priest is a childhood friend.
My sister is also on good terms with her, so she probably went to the shrine to see her and bought a fortune slip. I don't know why she would buy one for someone who isn't there, though.
That said, I feel encouraged, as if I have the support of the gods.

items.text: 'Pray that it doesn't crash.'
'Thank the gods for me.'

scenes.voice: 星奈さんとはちゃんと連絡とってるか
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Have you been in touch with Hoshina-san?'
Naruse grins and calls out to me as soon as we meet. It's probably pointless to worry about him more than myself.
Aokawa: 'It's okay. Thanks to our last meal, the atmosphere has gotten a lot better.'

scenes.voice: 良かった_じゃあデートはどこ行くかは決まった
scenes.text: Naruse: 'That's good. So, have you decided where to go for your date?'
Aokawa: 'No, not at all...'
Aokawa: 'Ah... I'm so anxious. What if the date is a failure and she doesn't want to see me anymore?'

scenes.voice: お前は真面目だもんなぁ_いっそのことプロジェクトだと思って取り組めば
scenes.text: Naruse: 'You're a serious person, aren't you? Why don't you just treat it like a project?'
Aokawa: 'A project... in that case, the first proposal has been approved, so the next step is a detailed plan based on the feedback.'
I mutter to myself about the structure, plan and milestones, budget and comparison with similar projects, risks and issues, and so on.

scenes.voice: いや_初デートの計画にそんなもんいらんだろ___そもそもお前_類似案件あんのか
scenes.text: Naruse: 'No, you don't need all that for a first date plan... Besides, do you even have any similar cases?'
Aokawa: '...In a game, maybe...'

scenes.voice: ぜったい類似してねぇから_それ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'That's definitely not a similar case...'
Aokawa: 'In the game, the protagonist's best friend had a feature that could measure the heroine's affection level.'

scenes.voice: 俺にそんな便利な機能はねぇ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'I don't have such a convenient feature.'

scenes.voice: どこ行くか決まったらレビューさせてくれ_じゃあな
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Let me review it once you've decided where to go. See you.'
With that, Naruse headed to his next meeting. He's as smart as ever. He provides the necessary support in a concise manner, as if he were a secret agent.
After returning from work, Aokawa was at home writing out a date plan. This has been his daily routine recently.
He was writing down the pros and cons of each spot, the risk of Hoshina not being interested, and a contingency plan in that case.
'A meteor shower is expected to be visible this weekend. It may be visible in Japan if the weather is good.'
The weekend weather forecast is on TV. A meteor shower, huh... I can't see it in the city.

scenes.voice: 携帯着信
scenes.text: My phone rings. Could it be Hoshina-san? I look at my phone with anticipation, but it's from my sister.
'Top secret information... it's your cute little sister's birthday soon.'
...A request for a present. I added [Choose a birthday present for my sister] to the pros and cons table of my date plan.

scenes.voice: 遅れました
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Sorry I'm late.'

Aokawa was standing alone on the first floor of a commercial building near Shinjuku Station when a smiling Hoshina came running up to him. She seems to be wearing the same clothes as last time, maybe it's her favorite outfit.
Since she wasn't used to the geography of Tokyo or the crowds, I avoided meeting at Shinjuku Station and chose a building near the station so we could go for lunch right away.
I had arrived a little early, but Hoshina had also come early, so we ended up meeting 15 minutes before the scheduled time.
Aokawa: 'It's not time yet. We're both too early.'

scenes.voice: 新宿駅って迷路みたいで道を間違ったら大変だって渋川さんに言われたので早めに来たんだけど_幸い道は間違
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Shibukawa-san told me that Shinjuku Station is like a maze and it would be terrible if I got lost, so I came early, but luckily I didn't get lost.'
Aokawa: 'I'm sorry for choosing such a difficult place.'

scenes.voice: あ_いえいえ_いろんな場所を知れて楽しいです
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Oh, no, no, it's fun to get to know different places.'
We moved to the restaurant while talking like that. The plan is to have lunch first, then enjoy the art exhibition and shopping at the commercial facilities near the station.
There are many places I want to go, but if it takes a long time to get there, I get nervous about keeping the conversation going, so I decided on a plan that's close by this time.
But I see she also told Shibukawa-san about the date plan. A burly old man comes to mind. I hope he's not watching us from afar...?

scenes.voice: はぁもうお腹ペコペコ_朝も何も食べてないし
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'I'm so hungry. I haven't eaten anything since this morning.'
Aokawa: 'You have to eat properly, it's not good for your health.'

scenes.voice: あまりお金がないので節約してて
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'I don't have much money, so I'm trying to save...'
Aokawa: 'I'm paying today, so please eat properly.'

scenes.voice: この前も出してもらったのに本当にすみません
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'I'm so sorry, you paid last time too...'
Aokawa: 'Don't hesitate. I'm always working and have no way to spend my money, so I have to use it on things like this.'
Hoshina hesitantly chooses her dishes, so I order a few more, saying I want to eat them too.
A little while later, the dishes are lined up in front of us. Maybe I overdid it a little to show off.

scenes.voice: わぁ_美味しい
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Wow, this is delicious!'
Aokawa: 'Yeah, this is my first time at this restaurant, but it's delicious.'
She's really enjoying her food. Just watching her makes me happy.

scenes.voice: こういうところにはあまり来ないの
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Don't you come to places like this often?'
Aokawa: 'On weekdays, I often work until the last train, and even if I go out, it's with colleagues for yakitori and beer, a typical salaryman thing. On weekends, I'm tired and just sleep.'

scenes.voice: アイティー会社って大変なのね
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'IT companies are tough, huh?'
Aokawa: 'I guess I just use my accumulated overtime pay to relieve stress once in a while.'

scenes.voice: ストレス発散も大事だけど_ちゃんと計画的に使わないと
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'It's important to relieve stress, but you have to use your money wisely.'
As she says that, Hoshina is clearing one plate after another. She's a surprisingly big eater...
Aokawa: 'That's why I'm using it wisely now.'

scenes.voice: 使い道に困ったらいつでもどうぞ
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'If you ever have trouble spending it, feel free to ask me anytime♪'
Aokawa: 'No, you really eat a lot.'

scenes.voice: あ_ごめんなさい
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Oh, I'm sorry!'
Aokawa: 'It's fun to watch someone eat with such enjoyment.'

scenes.voice: ふぐぅ
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Fuguu...'
Aokawa: 'Haven't you been eating properly?'

scenes.voice: 余裕のある生活はしてないかな_たまたま渋川さんと出会って働かせてもらって_それでなんとか
scenes.text: Hoshina: '...I guess I'm not living a comfortable life. I happened to meet Shibukawa-san and he gave me a job, so I'm managing somehow.'
Aokawa: 'So you knew him before you started working there?'

scenes.voice: うーん_そうね
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Well, yes.'
Aokawa: '...He's not watching us from somewhere, is he?'

scenes.voice: 知ってる_一キロ以上離れると銃声より先に銃弾が来るらしいよ
scenes.text: Hoshina: '...Did you know? If you're more than a kilometer away, the bullet arrives before the sound of the gunshot.'
Hoshina says with a straight face. I can't help but look out the window. Of course, I can't see anything... but wait, is he really there?

scenes.voice: 冗談_多分
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Just kidding, probably.'
Aokawa: 'Probably?!'
We spent a pleasant mealtime joking with each other. ...It was a joke, right?
After leaving the restaurant, I had her help me pick out a present for my sister. It would surely be better to have a woman choose it than me.
On the way, a game center catches my eye. There are many crane games lined up.
I thought Hoshina was looking at the stuffed animals with a longing expression, so I decided to invite her.
Aokawa: 'Shall we play for a bit?'
Hoshina: '...!'

scenes.voice: あ_ごめんなさい_顔に出てたかな_やったことなくて興味がすごくあって
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Oh, I'm sorry. Was it that obvious? I've never done it before, so I'm really interested...'
Aokawa: 'Then let's do it.'

I was surprised she'd never played a crane game before, but she said she'd lived abroad, so maybe they don't have as many crane games in Japan? We entered the game center and walked around the crane game corner.

scenes.voice: これが欲しいかな
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'I think I want this one.'
She points to a crane game with a keychain-sized doll of a cute,ゆる-kawaii character. I'm not interested, so I don't know the details, but it seems to be a popular character recently.
So this is the kind of thing she likes... I thought as I inserted the money.
Aokawa: 'Let's give it a first try.'

scenes.voice: ありがとう_よーしっ
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Thank you! Let's do this!'
She adjusts the position from the front and the side, taking her time, and then presses the button. The result is... unfortunately, it falls just short. It fell right in front.
After that, she put in more money several times and challenged the game with excitement.

scenes.voice: きゃーやったー_取れた
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Yay! I got it!'
She finally got the doll and jumped up and down with joy, then her face turned bright red when she noticed my warm gaze.
Aokawa: 'I'm so happy.'

scenes.voice: 年甲斐もなくはしゃいですみません
scenes.text: Hoshina: '...I'm sorry for getting so carried away, I'm too old for this...'

items.text: I think that's how it was when I first got one as a kid.
In fact, it's a reward.

scenes.text: After I said it, I felt like it wasn't much of a follow-up, but Hoshina was holding the doll in her hand as if it were precious.
After that, she helped me pick out a present for my sister.
My sister's request was a coin purse. She buys her own wallets, but a coin purse is not worth the cost to buy for herself... but she would like one if she could get it from someone.
We went to a few different stores to look around. On the way, I saw some clothes that would look good on Hoshina, so I suggested them.

scenes.voice: 欲しいけど_お金に余裕がなくて
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'I want it, but I don't have enough money...'
She says as she holds the clothes up to herself and stands in front of the mirror. It looks so good on her... I'm tempted to buy it for her, but I resist.

scenes.voice: あ_これなんかどうかな
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'Oh, how about this one?'
She puts back the clothes she was holding and suggests a coin purse from the small accessories corner nearby.
I imagine my sister holding it... yeah, I think it's good. I'll get this one. Or rather, I don't even know which one to buy anymore.
Aokawa: 'I'll go pay, wait here a minute.'
It was more expensive than I thought, but the more I look at it, the more I like it, so I'll just go with it. I'm sure she'll like it too.
There was a brooch near the cash register that would go well with Hoshina's outfit today, so I bought that too.
It's not expensive, so I'm sure she'll accept it without feeling burdened as a thank you for helping me choose a present. I had it nicely wrapped and went back to the entrance of the store.
There stood Hoshina, her face pale.
Aokawa: 'Are you not feeling well?'
I rush over to Hoshina. She notices me. She tries to say something, but her mouth stops.

scenes.voice: ごめんなさい
scenes.text: Hoshina: '...I'm sorry.'
Aokawa: 'What should I do? Let's find a place to rest.'
I take out my phone and search for something nearby.

scenes.voice: 本当にごめんなさい_今日はもう帰るね
scenes.text: Hoshina: 'I'm really sorry, I'm going home for today.'
Aokawa: 'You're pale, I'll take you home. Oh, I'll call a taxi.'

scenes.voice: 本当に大丈夫だから_じゃあ
scenes.text: Hoshina: '...I'm really fine, so I'll be going.'
Aokawa: 'Oh, wait, here.'
I say and hurriedly give her the brooch I bought.
Aokawa: 'Thank you for helping me out, I appreciate it.'

scenes.voice: ありがとう_今日はとっても楽しかった_こんなの久しぶりで嬉しかったよ
scenes.text: Hoshina: '...Thank you. I had a lot of fun today. It's been a while since I've had this much fun.'
With that, Hoshina bowed deeply and left. She seemed to be on the verge of tears.
What, did I do something wrong? No, she was clearly pale. She must have been telling the truth about not feeling well.

I suddenly worry about what would happen if she collapsed on the way, so I run after her. I'm in a panic because of the sudden turn of events. I can't believe I let a girl in that condition go home alone.

However, even when I chase after her, I can't find Hoshina. I look around for a while and run around, but she's not there. I think she might be in the bathroom, so I wait near the bathroom where we parted, but she doesn't come out.
'Are you okay? Did you get home safely?'
I send a message and give up and decide to go home too. I have a bad feeling in my chest that I might not be able to see her again.
I look up at the sky and see a shooting star.
Aokawa was sitting alone at his desk in the office. He hasn't been able to contact Hoshina since then.
I didn't even get a 'read' receipt all weekend. It's Monday, and although I'm at work, my hands are still and my mind is elsewhere, just staring blankly.
Naruse: 'What's up today? You look really tired.'
scenes.voice: 今日はどしたん_めっちゃ辛そうじゃん

scenes.text: Wait, am I time-leaping? Naruse called out to me.

scenes.voice: タイムリープじゃないぞ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'It's not a time leap.'
Aokawa: 'Why can you read my mind...'

scenes.voice: どうした_デートでやらかしたのか
scenes.text: Naruse: 'What's wrong? Did you mess up on your date?'
Aokawa: 'I don't think I messed up... She suddenly went home in the middle of our date with a pale face, and I haven't been able to contact her since.'

scenes.voice: 連絡取れないほど体調が悪い
scenes.text: Naruse: 'She's so sick she can't even contact you...?'
Aokawa: 'I was going to take her home, but I let her go by herself... I regret it. I'm worried something terrible might have happened to her after that.'

scenes.voice: 渋川さんには聞いてみたか
scenes.text: Naruse: '...Have you tried asking Shibukawa-san?'
Aokawa: 'That's right, maybe I can find out something if I ask Shibukawa-san. But what if she's just avoiding me...'

scenes.voice: それならそれで安否がわかって良いだろ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'Well, at least you'll know if she's safe.'
Aokawa: '...'

scenes.voice: どうせ仕事も手がつかないんだろ_早退して渋川さんのお店に行ってみたらどうだ
scenes.text: Naruse: 'You can't concentrate on work anyway, right? Why don't you leave early and go to Shibukawa-san's store?'
Aokawa: '...Thanks!'
With that, I told my team I was leaving early and rushed out of the company.
I had come to Shibukawa's convenience store.
Aokawa: 'Excuse me, is Shibukawa-san here?'
Seeing that there were no customers, I spoke to the clerk at the register. The clerk, who had long hair and a slightly flashy look but a solid build, was staring at Aokawa.
Convenience store clerk: 'Please wait a moment.'
With that, the clerk disappeared into the back of the store.
I was wondering if all the clerks here were bodybuilders when Shibukawa came out from the back.
Aokawa: 'It's been a while.'

scenes.voice: ちょっと外に出ようか
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'Let's go outside for a bit.'
When we went outside, Shibukawa sat on a bench in a nearby park. Aokawa stood in front of Shibukawa and waited for him to speak.
Does he know something...? I have a bad feeling about this.

scenes.voice: 俺も星奈くんとは連絡は取れない_今日も出勤予定だったが来ていない
scenes.text: Shibukawa: '...I can't get in touch with Hoshina-kun either. He was scheduled to come in today, but he didn't.'
Aokawa: 'I knew something was wrong...'

scenes.voice: 急にいなくなるかもしれないというは星奈くんからは言われていた
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'Hoshina-kun told me that he might disappear suddenly.'
Aokawa: 'What...?'

scenes.voice: 星奈くんはどんな様子だった_会ってたんだろ
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'What was Hoshina-kun like? You were with him, right?'
Aokawa: 'We were shopping, and he was fine until then, but when I met him after paying, he was pale and said he was going home for the day. I haven't been able to contact him since.'

scenes.voice: そうか
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'I see...'
Aokawa: 'What do you mean, he might disappear suddenly?'

scenes.voice: 教えてはくれなかったな
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'He didn't tell me.'
Aokawa: '...'

scenes.voice: 何かわかったら君にも連絡する_連絡先を交換しておこう
scenes.text: Shibukawa: 'I'll contact you if I find out anything. Let's exchange contact information.'
Aokawa: 'Okay.'
